intro: Raparia bulbosa, commonly known as the bulbous rapwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, lobed leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
